main.article:
Installation guide
Ubuntu
Installing prerequisites
sudo apt-get install git build-essential fftw3-dev itk3-dev libboost-dev libboost-system-dev libboost-thread-dev libboost-program-options-dev libnifti-dev liblapack-dev libgsl0-dev omniorb-nameserver libomniorb4-dev omniidl libatlas-dev autoconf libtool libinsighttoolkit3-dev
ISMRMRD
Stronlgy suggested for building in ISMRMRD support
sudo apt-get install xsdcxx cmake swig libpython-dev openjdk-7-jdk libxerces-c-dev python-numpy
git clone git://git.code.sf.net/p/ismrmrd/code ismrmrd
mkdir ismrmrd/build
cd ismrmrd/build
cmake ../
make
sudo make install
Unfortunately somebody has broken the HDF5 library which is shipped with Ubuntu (12.10-13.04). So either you take 12.04LTS or you will have to build HDF5 yourself. Download HDF5 from here:
http://www.hdfgroup.org/ftp/HDF5/current/src/
Build as follows. This will take a little while
cd hdf5-1.x.xx; ./configure --enable-cxx --prefix=/usr/local make make check sudo make install
NFFT 3
Get NFFT3 from here:
http://www-user.tu-chemnitz.de/~potts/nfft/download.php
tar xzf nfft-x.x.x/ CXXFLAGS="-Ofast -march=native" CFLAGS=$CXXFLAGS ./configure --enable-all make sudo make install
All of the above amounts to some 300 packages and 350 MB. Without ISMRMRD support roughly 150 packges and 160 MB less.
Getting codeare
git clone http://github.com/kvahed/codeare.git codeare
Building codeare
Fairly easy (f.e. ubuntu with MATLAB 2012a at the default location)
Configure with MATLAB and ISMRMRD support:
> CPPFLAGS="-I/usr/include/nifti" CXXFLAGS="-Ofast -march=native"\ CFLAGS=$CXXFLAGS ./configure --with-matlabroot=/opt/MATLAB/... \ --with-fftw=/usr --with-itkroot=/usr --disable-static > make > wget http://codeare.org/download/matlab_share.tar.gz #if built with MATLAB support else: > wget http://codeare.org/download/hdf5_share.tar.gz # Unpack with tar xzf > export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/local/lib > make check > make install
